Text:
Increasing access to quality child care will open doors to opportunity for families in Oregon and across the country.
 
https://t.co/du9IO0JxRn #CareCantWait

I have spoken with many Oregonians, especially moms, who have been limited by lack of access to affordable child care, home care, and paid family leave. Care can’t wait!

#TimeforAction #CareCantWait https://t.co/Vqoe1tkEPH

As a policymaker & former public school parent, I'm eternally grateful for the tireless dedication of our many teachers & school staff. I'm committed to making sure schools have the policies & resources they need to provide a quality education to all students. #PublicSchoolProud https://t.co/y7e65IZDQj

It is an honor to co-lead the #PublicSchoolsWeek Resolution. Our system of public education is important for our children, families, community, and economy. 
https://t.co/oXR2xvYjQQ
We must use all diplomatic and economic tools at our disposal to protect the lives and freedom of Ukrainians.

Putin’s invasion of Ukraine is dangerous and requires a swift response. I support imposing sanctions, including those announced by President Biden and our EU allies, to condemn Russia’s aggressive actions and to deter further hostilities.

I strongly condemn this deadly attack and call for the person responsible to be held fully accountable. My heart goes out to the victim’s loved ones and all the people who were harmed while standing up for racial justice and exercising their right to speak out.

The right to peacefully protest is essential to our democracy. Many facts are still unclear about what happened during a protest for racial justice in Normandale Park this weekend. We know that a man attacked protestors, killing one person and severely wounding others.
I support the Biden administration’s diplomatic efforts, and remain hopeful that we can diffuse tensions and save lives.

I am continuing to closely monitor Russia’s aggressive actions against Ukraine. Russia frequently flouts international norms and has repeatedly attempted to undermine democracy, including in the U.S. It is unacceptable.

Old-growth forests are a powerful resource in our fight against the climate crisis and must be safeguarded. I joined several of my colleagues in calling for our old-growth and mature forests to be protected and restored. https://t.co/UxAuaua7Zk

We must address systemic racism in homeownership access. The #BuildBackBetterAct would invest in making sure all first-generation homeowners have the opportunity to buy a home.
 
https://t.co/PV5GahZNmn
Learn more about how we're helping families save money as we address the climate crisis: https://t.co/KftP9JrBG5

Hearing from students is one of my favorite parts of representing NW Oregon in Congress. I enjoyed meeting with the students at Warrenton High School and answering their questions.
 https://t.co/dBCnN0J8k4

A new report from @NOAA found that sea levels will rise up to a foot in the next 30 years. This is a siren for #ClimateActionNow. We also need mitigation and adaptation investments for coastal communities on the front lines.
 
https://t.co/WWSuWolD1A

Creating more pathways to quality jobs will change lives and transform our economy. Read what @OregonGovBrown & I are doing at the state and federal levels to expand, diversify, and support our workforce.

https://t.co/QetFWEN9ZI

Batteries are fundamental to clean energy storage and electrifying the transportation sector. This $3 billion investment will help expand battery manufacturing, recycling, and processing capabilities here in the U.S.
 https://t.co/1VRYO3Y6QW
I am celebrating Oregon's history by talking with her future: high school students in Warrenton and Tigard! Happy Birthday Oregon. The future is bright. https://t.co/D5NTtjTK67

The Emergency Rental Assistance program has prevented evictions across our state throughout the pandemic, but many renters are still struggling because of Omicron. I led my Oregon colleagues in calling for additional funding to help keep families & individuals in their homes. https://t.co/KfUdVIslp3

I played a lead role in negotiating the environmental provisions in USMCA to protect wildlife like the critically endangered vaquita marina. I’m glad @AmbassadorTai is taking this important step.
https://t.co/LF7M1N7MOp

My heart goes out to @RepClark and all the parents who have experienced miscarriage. Years ago I had one too. Reproductive health care is essential for many reasons, and we must protect it. https://t.co/8xhtano5dK

Oregon has the talented workforce, innovative leadership & manufacturing prowess to continue to be a powerhouse in the semi-conductor industry. I appreciate Sen @RonWyden's leadership in creating this Taskforce and I look fwd to joining in the work ahead. https://t.co/nBIDZpuNn7

#ElectrifyingAmerica will help us combat the climate crisis, create good-paying jobs, and reduce pollution. Thanks to federal funding in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Oregon will be able to invest in $7.7 million in electric vehicle charging infrastructure. https://t.co/huT7KtB4Sx

Unions give workers a voice in their workplace and improve working conditions for everyone. That's true in NW Oregon and it's true on Capitol Hill. I'm glad to support the resolution recognizing the right of Congressional staff to organize.

The LGBTQ+ community faces state-sanctioned hate and violence in many countries around the world. The House passed the #GlobalRespectAct to send a clear message that we will not tolerate the persecution  of LGBTQ+ people. There are no exceptions to human rights. https://t.co/6omyoDSHx7

The Biden administration is providing free N95 masks to help reduce the spread of COVID. A good mask is important to protect against Omicron. You can pick up yours at one of these pharmacies or stores: https://t.co/10z4MHN79j

Quality USPS service is essential for Oregonians to receive prescription medication, run small businesses, and so much more. Today I voted for the bipartisan #PostalServiceReformAct to make USPS financially sustainable, require timely delivery, & increase accountability. https://t.co/Qjb564Bgfr

Today for #SaferInternetDay I'm joining @RepSusanWild in calling on @YouTube to save lives by taking down "How to Tie a Noose" videos. It's past time to #TakeThemDown to protect kids who are considering suicide. https://t.co/0KycySlp0I

We have now lost more than 900,000 people to COVID-19 in the U.S. This is a devastating tragedy, and I grieve with all who lost loved ones. Let us live on in their memory, and do all we can to care for those around us.

https://t.co/iU57lcW6wq
The Trump Admin’s #DirtyWaterRule threatens our drinking water sources, and it cannot stand. I joined 120 of my colleagues in calling for this harmful rule to be repealed. https://t.co/4jVa1rTd1Q

The best way to contain the spread of COVID-19 is to get vaccinated and boosted, and for all of us to closely follow the public health guidelines. For more information about vaccine access in your community, call 211, or visit https://t.co/CXFjDEyGAi

Don't forget, you can order free at-home COVID tests and get them in the mail! The short request form only takes a minute to fill out and does not require any credit card or bank information. Order here: https://t.co/GlGwdOrTCG

I support @RepCheri's legislation to #EndForcedArbitration so survivors of sexual assault & harassment are not deterred from seeking justice. Survivors often speak out at great personal risk, & they frequently take on very powerful people. We must continue to empower their voices https://t.co/UNNK3aHBOl

I was incredibly moved by the Nelson Mandela exhibit @OMSI honoring his life, accomplishments, and legacy. Nelson Mandela’s life story can inspire us all. His values and commitment to justice remain as vital now as they were during his lifetime. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/KwiZA9DZDm
Happy Birthday to Genevieve Holtum of Hillsboro, who is turning 100 years old today! I wish you continued health and happiness in the days and years ahead. https://t.co/unGgWvG7Jo

#Childcare providers need COVID testing and PPE to protect the health of our nation’s children. I am joining @RepKClark to secure these critical resources for child care workers. Parents, kids, and the care economy need our support because #CareIsEssential https://t.co/aAoiPi2AWc

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will take big steps toward rebuilding our economy and helping to fix some of the problems we've seen during the pandemic. I look forward to working to get this law over the finish line and bring the benefits home to Oregonians.
ADDRESS THE CLIMATE CRISIS by helping clean energy technologies make the leap from idea to implementation, and protect our ocean with 3 of my bipartisan ocean bills https://t.co/tvVbho0fTy
FIX SUPPLY CHAINS to keep goods flowing to consumers and manufacturers and prevent the shortages and disruptions we experienced during the pandemic https://t.co/XMprh0r6ZV
CREATE JOBS and pathways for workers to enter them, thanks to my bipartisan BUILDS and PARTNERS Acts and the first update to the National Apprenticeship act in 90 years https://t.co/Yf1ydBBEM5
INVEST IN RESEARCH, innovation, and US manufacturing to maintain our global leadership https://t.co/iTtlTIz5Co

STRENGTHEN the semiconductor industry, which employs tens of thousands of workers in NW Oregon and is key to our global competitiveness in auto manufacturing, technology, and more https://t.co/Y78KlX2rnq
I'm thrilled to help the House pass the #AmericaCOMPETES Act today to strengthen our economy. Here are 5 things this important and comprehensive bill will do: https://t.co/a20hIF7ZZo
Unions give workers a voice in the decisions that directly affect them. It's exciting to see Starbucks workers in Oregon and around the country moving toward forming a union! https://t.co/bnDsyTPx1v
We still have work to do to rebuild our economy equitably, but 2021 was the best year of economic growth since 1984! Thanks to @POTUS for your leadership. https://t.co/6VeegdVIZK

The Regional Clean Energy Innovation Act will create partnerships that bring together relevant stakeholders to overcome innovation barriers & deploy clean energy solutions that support decarbonization.

Developing and bringing to market clean energy technologies that meet local and regional needs is essential to our successful transition to a clean energy economy.
https://t.co/jp7yF6p3Wr

This #BlackHistoryMonth is a great time to learn the history of the civil rights movement here in Oregon. The fight for civil rights continues today, and it didn't just take place in the South. Thanks to @ORHist for this wonderful virtual exhibit. https://t.co/tFhLO55NI8
Happy #LunarNewYear to everyone who is celebrating! Wishing you and your families good health, peace, and prosperity. https://t.co/Rl0PokvN8t

Too often, students don’t have enough time to eat their meals at school. I'm glad to work with pediatrician and fellow Congressmom @RepKimSchrier to improve access to nutritious meals and reduce food waste. https://t.co/RmC1HRnG2M
It’s past time to work together to end gun violence. #GVSurvivorsWeek

More than 100 people die every day from guns, and too many children experience the pain & trauma of losing a loved one to gun violence. Since Columbine and other school shootings, most students now do active shooter drills in school. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/8GisiLuaP7

Supply chain issues and the rising cost of basic necessities are real problems, and this week the House will vote on comprehensive legislation to help. The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will strengthen our competitive edge and address many of the complicated economic issues we face.

Laurie Weitkamp’s research is important for the future of salmon in Oregon around the globe. I look forward to seeing her team's findings! 
https://t.co/fQn04MqqS1

Every word of this op-ed is worth reading. Thank you, Yaritza Perez, for your service in the Marines and for your call to action. We need #ClimateAction now. 
https://t.co/06cRYI4bQG

Today is #EITC awareness Day. Estimates show that more than 25% of eligible Oregonians miss out on this additional support. The #AmericanRescuePlan made #EITC more flexible & raises the value for millions of workers. Learn more about claiming this credit below: https://t.co/T8RAU7PMbn

Rental assistance is available again to Oregonians. If you need help covering rent, apply here: 
https://t.co/fw27g84Blk
https://t.co/Z8Hpl3xUMo
When I was a child, I never would have imagined that I would someday run for office, let alone become a Member of Congress. Every day it is an honor to serve Northwest Oregon. https://t.co/tezmXFVmUY

I’m pleased to join @RepStefanik in urging the USDA to follow the recommendations of the National Academies, encourage states to provide flexibility for families, and increase access to more nutritious foods.

WIC is a lifeline for many families, providing infants and children with the nutritious meals they need to grow and thrive. The current size restrictions some states choose for products like yogurt create an unnecessary barrier to healthy foods. https://t.co/c5JqXJfoXP
This Congress, 201 climate policies recommended in the @ClimateCrisis Climate Action Plan have already been signed into law. Here’s the tracker on our progress so far: https://t.co/yGW5G8WQrk
I commend this success, but we must get additional legislation, like the climate provisions in Build Back Better, across the finish line to move closer to achieving our goals.
With Democratic leadership in the House, Senate, & White House, we were able to pass and have signed into law the bipartisan infrastructure law. https://t.co/vqZuHGasN9
We must achieve economy-wide decarbonization and provide a just transition for communities historically dependent on fossil fuels.

I applaud the steps the Biden-Harris administration has taken in the past year. They have restored the role of science in decision-making and set ambitious goals that we can continue to build on—but there is much more to be done. https://t.co/5Q5baO3IbN

You can learn more about the Climate Action Plan here: https://t.co/EdiExCQhju  

And there is more information about my contributions and legislation here: https://t.co/wz1nyhV0r5

The Climate Action Plan includes my BLUE GLOBE & Blue Carbon for our Planet Acts. These bills will expand data collection and ocean monitoring efforts and help research, protect, and conserve blue carbon ecosystems. Both bills will help us reach 30 x 30 conservation targets.

We must work together at every level of government to #ActOnClimate. The executive orders complement the @ClimateCrisis Climate Action Plan, which I helped develop to set our nation on a path to reach net-zero emissions no later than mid-century & net-negative thereafter. https://t.co/1naNTsorYH
I was pleased that one week after his inauguration, President Biden announced his intention to achieve the goal of conserving at least 30 percent of our lands and waters by 2030.

As Co-Chair of the House Oceans Caucus & House Estuaries Caucus, I have long called for efforts to protect & restore our nation’s ocean and estuaries. These resources offer great carbon sequestration & climate mitigation potential & are critical to Oregon’s economy and ecology. https://t.co/GAzIKmd74v

Climate action means jobs. One of the steps I'm grateful the Biden-Harris administration took was to restore labor standards that support good-paying, union jobs. I am continuing to advance legislation that will create clean energy jobs & give workers the support they need.

It makes a world of difference to have a President & VP who believe in science! After four years of defending science and the environment from the disastrous Trump administration, it was a relief to have multiple executive orders address climate action at the federal level. https://t.co/8xVm69xSc1

Buildings are an important part of solving the Climate Crisis. Oregon is a leader in green buildings and ranks eighth nationwide in #Top10LEED states! We can build a more sustainable future. 
https://t.co/cF2xzyf4VE

On International #HolocaustRemembrance Day, we solemnly remember the millions of Jews and other victims who perished at the hands of the Nazis. Never Again. Antisemitism is still a threat, and we must rally together to defeat it.

You can help by donating, hosting a blood drive, or volunteering at a blood drive. Make an appointment to give blood or volunteer  by using the Red Cross Blood Donor App, calling 1-800-RED CROSS (1-800-733-2767), or visiting https://t.co/gI505FbfHP
Our country is facing the worst blood shortage in more than a decade. Blood shortages can lead to doctors making difficult decisions about who receives blood transfusions and who must wait.

I was in high school when Roe v. Wade became law. Today I spoke with a high school student who is concerned about what the future could look like. We must keep fighting, for her and her generation. 
#bansoffourbodies https://t.co/OY1guAXdsD
We must #ActforAbortionAccess, and we need the Senate to pass the #WHPA, which the House passed months ago.

But if the Supreme Court overturns #RoevWade, many states could and would ban abortion outright. When abortion is banned it doesn't go away; it just becomes more dangerous. I lived through the days before Roe. We can't go back.

It's been 49 years since #RoevWade affirmed the right to abortion.
Today, nearly 1 in 4 women in America will have an abortion by age 45. Abortion is health care, and these important decisions should be made by a patient and their health care provider. https://t.co/QQ4z47csS6

We need to build a child care system that works for parents, children, & the caregiving workforce. The #AmericanRescuePlan helped child care providers keep their doors open. But we won’t recover until all families have affordable child care. Let’s get them the help they need now. https://t.co/g4xoWqDHkP

The EVEST Act will automatically enroll all eligible veterans into @DeptVetAffairs health care services. This bill will help veterans thrive after military service and prevent almost 60,000 veterans a year from falling through the cracks. 

https://t.co/z8jK6Xdq5G
The filibuster is distorting democracy. We can't let an outdated rule stop legislation that will help millions of people access their right to vote. The fight for #VotingRights will continue.
Thank you to @SenMerkley and your Democratic colleagues for leading the way for civil rights. https://t.co/suylkhTKrc
No se requiere ningún dato adicional como tarjeta de crédito o estatus migratorio y la información proporcionada tampoco será compartida con otras agencias federales. https://t.co/BWj2eHWxOV

Todos los hogares ahora pueden solicitar 4 pruebas gratuitas de detección del covid-19 en casa. El Servicio Postal entregará las pruebas en 7 a 12 días. Esta es una inversión federal fundamental para ayudar a mantener seguras a nuestras familias y comunidades.

Every household can now order 4 free at-home COVID-19 tests. The US Postal Service will deliver the tests in 7-12 days. This is a critical federal investment to help keep our families and communities safe.
https://t.co/GlGwdOrTCG

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. said: “Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability, but comes through continuous struggle.”
 
Today, we pay tribute to Dr. King and recommit to the struggle for justice. #MLKDay https://t.co/s4bvYJT8PE

Arts education inspires students and opens doors to new possibilities. Learn more about my Arts Education for All Act, which will help close opportunity gaps so all students can benefit from the arts. #ArtsEducationforAll
https://t.co/cWB84y3sBR

Today, @USDOT announced $40 billion in new funding for our nation’s bridges. This investment will provide more than $268 million in funding to upgrade Oregon’s bridges, create good-paying jobs, and help our nation #BuildBackBetter. https://t.co/xDLK6x1TQp

The #ChildTaxCredit is changing the lives of millions of children and parents. I have heard from so many moms like Amanda in NW Oregon; it makes a difference. The Senate must take up #BuildBackBetter and help families in Oregon and across the country. https://t.co/4zT7JrkwJE

The #SCOTUS ruling today is disappointing, but the issue still remains. COVID-19 vaccines save lives and protect workers. Employers should require vaccination to protect public health & workplace safety and to help our country recover from this prolonged health crisis. https://t.co/MffyMLW6EU

Today the House passed the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act to protect the fundamental right to vote. It is time for the Senate to reflect the will of the people and pass this important legislation. #FightForVotingRights
https://t.co/Wxjy7Fkd1h

Responsibly developed offshore wind is an important part of America's clean energy transition. I applaud the Administration for taking this important step and for continuing to make our nation's response to the #ClimateCrisis a top priority. https://t.co/kJVspzPnB0

Oregon's National Guard members go above and beyond to help our communities, & have been especially important during pandemic. I support the Guard and Reserve GI Bill Parity Act because our Guard & Reserve members deserve full access to GI Bill benefits. #EveryDayInUniformCounts

The #ChildTaxCredit drastically cut child poverty and helped to combat hunger. This historic tax cut for middle-class and working families makes a positive difference. The Senate should act now to #BuildBackBetter so families continue receiving this critical benefit. https://t.co/HrVl54FKgg
Please visit https://t.co/YM3GrsaYTq or contact my office for additional information.

The IRS announced that the 2022 tax-filing season will start on January 24. As the IRS continues to navigate this unprecedented time, they urge taxpayers to file electronically and to sign up for direct deposit to speed up your refund.
https://t.co/E1IGBj6F4N

In the city where John Lewis and Dr. King made history, @POTUS called on the Senate to set aside the filibuster to protect our democracy. He's right. #VotingRights are more important than an outdated procedural rule.
My heroic colleague, the late John Lewis, said: "The vote is precious. It is almost sacred. It is the most powerful non-violent tool we have in a democracy."
Since 2020, 19 states have passed laws to make it harder to vote. These voter suppression efforts will intensify in 2022. Our democracy is at stake.

Protecting the right to vote should not be partisan; in fact, in 2006 the Senate voted 98-0 to update the #VotingRightsAct. 
The House has passed the #ForThePeople Act to strengthen democracy & the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. The Senate must act.

We know that #universalprek will help us #BuildBackBetter. Everyone benefits when we set up all of our children for success and when parents, especially moms, can return to work. Let’s get this done for families, children, and the economy. https://t.co/kmSh3KCWGt
There's a lot happening in Congress. Listen to this conversation about #ClimateJobs, #BuildBackBetter, affordable higher education, #VotingRights and what to expect in 2022. https://t.co/yRYseI4Duj

Everyone deserves a warm, safe home. #BuildBackBetter would invest billions in affordable housing and addressing homelessness. Our communities urgently need this investment.
https://t.co/jWPrl9wrje

Everyone deserves a safe place to live. Many people in our communities do not have a home, which is especially concerning during winter weather. The warming shelter run by @JustCompassion1 & @CityofBeaverton is essential for adults experiencing homelessness in @WashcoOregon https://t.co/zsZW8Yynm2

Making sure Oregonians can stay safe in their homes must be a priority during the pandemic. This injection of federal funds will more than double OR’s typical annual funding and allow more households to receive support with their heating and utility bills. https://t.co/jQjSM2YKLh

Expanding affordable housing is crucial for working families in NW Oregon. I appreciated my visit to The Mary Ann in @CityofBeaverton with @REACHCDC & @BienestarOR. I will keep advocating for the investments needed to end the #housing affordability crisis & #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/arcxfnTJ89

The arts help us understand our lives and the world, and we must make sure that these opportunities fully reflect the lives of Black Americans & Indigenous peoples. @PDXArtMuseum’s new initiative is showcasing the breadth & depth of our communities and lifting up amazing artists. https://t.co/ZpHmo8EHee

My team of caseworkers is here to help. Please contact my office at 503-469-6010 if you require assistance with a federal agency, including Social Security, Medicare, student loans, immigration, the IRS, and more.  

https://t.co/rC8PO9CoLt
I'll keep working to strengthen food assistance programs like SNAP and Meals on Wheels. https://t.co/EdMuZU92Aa

No one should go hungry in the United States. I applaud @Centro_WashCo for stepping up to help feed thousands of families in Washington County. With the new Centro Mercado, more families will be able to access healthy and culturally specific food. https://t.co/U5O7Mn2uK7
This was the worst crisis our democracy has faced in my lifetime, and we all have a duty to acknowledge it, remember it, and make sure nothing like it ever happens again. #January6thAnniversary

I will always remember what it was like to be at the Capitol that day. And I will always remember that just hours after that attack, my colleagues and I returned to do our jobs and certify the free and fair election of our next President. 
https://t.co/uR0VbFqeYs

The Capitol attack on January 6, 2021 was unprecedented and un-American. Rioters injured more than 140 Capitol Police officers. 5 people lost their lives. The rioters chanted about killing our elected leaders and many carried weapons, zip ties, and maps.

It was exciting to hear from @PacificU students who are the next generation of health care heroes. The critical and supportive program they are in will help meet the growing need for health care professionals, including in rural and underserved areas. https://t.co/dcTYEXwJr9

As winter weather persists in Oregon, please call 211 if you need help finding shelter or services. In Portland, if you are concerned about others in cold temperatures, you can call the non-emergency response line at 503-823-3333. If it’s an emergency, call 911.

I’ve called for these benefits to be extended throughout the pandemic, and I’m committed to doing all I can to provide borrowers with the support they need, including safety net protections when payments eventually resume. https://t.co/gzojxmRn3E
Did you hear that the student loan moratorium for COVID-19 was extended? The pause on student loan payments, interest, and debt collection will continue until May 2021. https://t.co/cYQhwZtpHb

Because of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, Oregon is getting $92 million to improve our drinking water.

https://t.co/v8SUbgKt5k

Sign up for my newsletter and start the year by receiving monthly updates about the work I’m doing in Congress to help improve the lives of Oregonians.

https://t.co/KPADue5YWu

At the start of this new year, let’s all take a moment to reflect on the challenges we have overcome and the strength we’ve gained. 2021 was a difficult year in many ways, but we have come a long way. I wish everyone a bright new year and many happy days to come. https://t.co/jB5ZEnTDQe
2021 was a challenging year in many ways. I helped deliver federal funding so our small businesses, schools, and health centers can continue their essential work. https://t.co/H9USTj5o9E

I hosted a resource fair to help seniors and their caregivers access federal support. Experts from Social Security & Medicare and the Oregon Department of Justice joined me to answer questions. Please share this video with anyone who may benefit.
https://t.co/iOaPDgQqWK

Many parents have told me how the #ChildTaxCredit helped them put food on the table, pay for child care, and meet their family's basic needs during a difficult year. I'm continuing to advocate for this important policy to be extended into 2022 and beyond. https://t.co/WGEfp0T3B7
2021 has been a challenging year, but we’ve made significant progress to a better future. Join me for a look back in my Instagram story: https://t.co/BkzMKdcjpD https://t.co/NWwD69ypDy

Did you know that there are thousands of people who are eligible for forgiveness through the Public Service Student Loan Forgiveness Program? Listen to my webinar for answers to common questions about whether you or someone you know will qualify.

https://t.co/JQTmOPjmnc

The scientists who developed the COVID-19 vaccine are heroes in every sense of the word. They've saved countless lives and deserve our deepest gratitude.

https://t.co/GzvcltH5aQ

Congrats to @NASA and partners on launching #NASAWebb!
🛠️40+ mil. total hours of construction
🤝Thousands of scientists, engineers & technicians
🌎14 countries
1 amazing opportunity to #UnfoldtheUniverse!✨ https://t.co/hM2SzhNC82
I wish a happy #Kwanzaa to all who are celebrating. Let us strive for unity to bring blessings to all. https://t.co/ZKlozM0iIm
Merry Christmas to all who are celebrating! May your day and the upcoming year be filled with joy and peace. https://t.co/ymxOxJzzEZ
Learn more about the Portland-based support organization here: https://t.co/1MghbUZhoR

Support for the adult lines is also available via text from 2-6 p.m. Mon-Fri: 
•For mental health or emotional distress, text 273TALK to 839863
•For Service Members, Vets or their families, text mil1 to 839863
•For substance use resources & support, text recoverynow to 839863

Youthline: 877-968-8491 or text teen2teen (839863)
Alcohol and Drug Helpline: 800-923-4357
Suicide Lifeline: 800-273-8255 
Military Helpline: 888-457-4838

General Support: 800-273-8255
Racial Equity Support: 503-575-3764
Senior Loneliness: 503-200-1633
If you or someone you know is feeling isolated or struggling this holiday season, @Lines_for_Life has people waiting by the phone, ready to talk 24/7. Make a call today:
The consent decree these Tribes were forced to sign is racist and unjust, and we must right this wrong by passing this legislation to restore their hunting and fishing rights.

For too long the people of the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde and the Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians have been denied their full right to hunt and fish in their ancestral homelands. https://t.co/K7RNiAG5eP
This federal investment of $92 million will provide clean safe drinking water to hundreds of thousands of Oregonians. That’s what it means to #BuildBackBetter.
Lead and contaminants pose serious health threats to Oregonians. As a mom and a policymaker, I’m especially concerned about making sure our kids can drink clean water at home and at school.

Access to safe and reliable drinking water is critical for our communities to stay healthy and thrive. 
https://t.co/B43IhNdRqa

Today's announcement is great news for Oregonians and people across the country. The pause on student loan payments has provided needed relief to borrowers during the challenges of COVID-19, and I've called for these benefits to be extended through the pandemic. https://t.co/n54u5vnN0v

As the number of Omicron cases continues to rise, vaccines & testing are our best tools to stay healthy and prevent hospitals from becoming overcrowded. Booster shots are already widely available, and soon at-home COVID tests will be available for free.
 
https://t.co/rcenZhojGA

Under @POTUS' leadership, Oregon gained 92,700 jobs in 2021. And we're set to create millions more across the country through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Plan that was signed into law. This is great news for Oregon and our country. https://t.co/IC3jpolD0g

The outdated and discriminatory #HelmsAmendment has now denied essential abortion care to millions of people worldwide for 48 years. We must #RepealHelms by passing the #AbortionIsHealthcareEverywhereAct.
https://t.co/VJTaynpHGi

It is past time that we provide the resources and support that working families and our communities need to thrive. This is an exciting day for our country, and I look forward to delivering these resources to Oregon.

Importantly, these investments are completely paid for by asking large corporations and the wealthiest to pay their fair share. The Build Back Better Act will create more stability and security for families by lowering everyday costs and easing inflationary pressures.

We are taking bold action that will lower child care and family care costs, make essential health care more affordable, create good-paying jobs, provide more affordable housing, and address the climate crisis.

The #BuildBackBetter Act is a victory for children, families, caregivers, early childhood educators, and our planet. This monumental legislation will improve lives and create more opportunities for Oregonians and people across the country.

#CareCantWait. We can #SolveChildCare, provide #UniversalPreK, help families, and grow our economy.

It doesn't have to be this way. The #BuildBackBetterAct makes a $390 billion investment to expand child care access & secure a living wage for providers. It will help 9 out of 10 families with young children and reach about 20 million children per year.

Meanwhile too many child care providers are thinking about closing, & many educators are leaving because they do not get the pay they need & deserve. This is an issue of racial & economic justice. The child care workforce is overwhelmingly women, and predominantly women of color.

This week I'm thinking about the moms & parents who have told me their stories: the single mother of 3 who had to stop working to care for her kids, the married paramedics w/ no paid family leave for their newborn, the moms patching together care from family & friends, and more.
I have been working hard for a game-changing investment to fix the #ChildCareCrisis. We are very close to winning a huge victory for families in the #BuildBackBetter Act.

If families don’t have access to child care, the economic crisis won’t end for parents, especially for mothers. Moms in particular have been forced out of the workforce in staggering numbers. We can't #BuildBackBetter without child care. THREAD https://t.co/jkdNBYQlya
